## Inline Code and Code Blocks

Use `library(fixest)` to load the package. The function
`feols()` estimates fixed-effects models.

```r
library(fixest)
library(data.table)

# Estimate a simple model
dt <- fread("data.csv")
est <- feols(y ~ x1 + x2 | fe1 + fe2, data = dt)
summary(est)
```

## Mathematics

Inline math: The utility function is $u(c) = \log(c)$.

Display math:

$$
E[u(c)] = p_l \cdot u(c_l) + (1 - p_l) \cdot u(c_h)
$$

A multi-line derivation:

$$
\begin{align*}
  \frac{dW}{db} &= (1-e)\left[u_l'(c_l)
    - \left(1 - \frac{\epsilon}{e}\right) u_h'(c_h)\right] \\
  M_{W(b)} &= \frac{u_l'(c_l) - u_h'(c_h)}{u_h'(c_h)}
    - \frac{\epsilon}{e}
\end{align*}
$$
